means: 伽利略(1564-1642，意大利物理及天文学家)

sentence.Network_en: These truths were by no means self - evident when Galileo first suggested them.
sentence.Network_cn: 伽里略首次提出这些真理时决非显而易见.

sentence.Network_en: The old view of Galileo was delightfully uncomplicated.
sentence.Network_cn: 过去对伽利略的看法并不复杂(指不深奥),这是令人欣然的.

sentence.Network_en: Descartes received his stimulus from the new physics and astronomy of Copernicus, Galileo, and others.
sentence.Network_cn: 笛卡儿从哥白尼、伽利略等人的新物理学和天文学中得到启发。

the modern scientific method is usually attributed to galileo ., 现代科学方法通常被认为是伽里略创造的.

means.word_mean: 1. Italian astronomer and mathematician who was the first to use a telescope to study the stars; demonstrated that different weights descend at the same rate; perfected the refracting telescope that enabled him to make many discoveries (1564-1642)
